TopicTitle: Able to execute "angle snap" on the "final end" of connector and fuel duct

Articles.Content:
The angle snap can't work on the "final end" of those linking parts after attaching the "starting end" of them.

Edited July 27, 2013 by Cesrate
It works for me, you sure you aren't trying to put it at a place where it's a bit tight and a lot of stuff is around? I know other collision boxes can prevent it attaching nicely.

It works for me, you sure you aren't trying to put it at a place where it's a bit tight and a lot of stuff is around? I know other collision boxes can prevent it attaching nicely.

The final end?

Oh dammit, I didn't read carefully, my bad. Hm, it's true getting angle snap on that part would be useful, I wonder how the editor logic works for struts and fuel line and if something is actually making this feature weird or hard to add to those parts on the second connection or if it was simply a design choice.
I place temporarily angle snapped struts on the "other end" ,so I had some guidelines when placing struts/fuel lines .
